result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Sentencing Hearing 7/6/16
Cover Letter from court reporter

Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Raabe states they are now ready to proceed.  Parties rec/rev revocation summary.  No corrections to be made but notes some missing facts re: incarceration at Racine.  That information has not be attained yet but DE wishes to proceed w/o that information.  State states she would like P&P Agent Laura Daly to speak re: sentencing.  Atty Raabe asks questions of agent.  Witness excused.  State makes recommendation.  Atty Raabe makes recommendation.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of felony firearms warnings, voting rights and post-conviction rights.

Ct 1:
Prison for 5 years (3 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision) to commence FORTHWITH
Any unpaid costs/surcharges/fines to be converted to civil judgments
AODA/Treatment
Sex offender treatment
Any other counseling or conditions per agent
547 days sentence credit to be applied
Not eligible for CIP or the SAP program

Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have rec/rev revocation summary and warrant and letter dated 4/18/2016.  Atty Raabe notes some discrepancies in re: to the letter referred to.  State says that's the first she's heard of that.  Atty Raabe points out exactly where the discrepancy is and notes he would be willing to get some documentation re: the statements by doctors if the Court would like it.  Notes that the DE isn't going anywhere for a while.  States takes no positition.  Court notes he wants the full picture and accurate information.  Court asks Atty Raabe to gather additional materials and matter can then be placed back on for sentencing after revocation hearing.  Bond continued.  Notices for new date will be provided.

Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in court in custody and with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State notes 14CF12 is resolved and 14CF425 is to be dismissed.  Atty Benavides agrees.  State states agreement.  Atty Benavides agrees w/recs as stated and they did review the PSI and have no corrections to make.  State makes brief statement/notes victim has been notified.  Atty Benavides makes statement.  DE makes brief statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of felony firearm warngins, voting rights and appeal rights.

7 years probation

Sentencing hearing on March 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Benavides gives status - has additional information for the court.  Packet of information from DE went to DOC and not to social worker.  Previous order to Atty. Benavides was to get in contact w/DOC to supplement the record, misunderstood.  State states DE still hasn't cooperated with DOC to do report/PSI.  Efforts were to be made on the locations of DE and do report before today.  DE knows his obligation to make self available for PSI.  ADA Hoffman states agent Belk is not going to finish PSI on packet, need face to face.  Court wants to go forward but wants more information.  Atty. Benavides requests reset.  ADA Hoffman has no objection.  Court grants reset.  DE to make self available for PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in court, in custody.  Prosecuting Atty Linda A. Hoffman appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides appeared by phone means for Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths.  State gives status.  14CF425 addressed.  Attorney Benavides does plan to meet with defendant over this weekend to discuss case with defendant.  State to advise DOC that defendant is being housed at Sauk Co. Jail.  DOC to supplement the PSI.  Attorney Benavides to address issue with defendant at next meeting.  Attorney Benavides to contact State on Monday, Dec 22 to give status of supplementing the document.  Sentencing date remains.
Status hearing on December 18, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths by video with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes Atty Benavides is ill and the Court was to call him but he will simply reset the matters.  Bond continued.

Sentencing hearing on December 15, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in court with attorney Dennis Joseph Ryan.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Ryan states status.  DE failed to appear at the requested time for PSI as he has lost contact w/the DE.  States DE is now homeless but he has instructed the DE to follow through w/necessary steps to do the PSI.  Court advises he will reset the matter but considers holding DE in jail pending completion of the PSI.  Court isn't clear on why there would have been any confusion.  State requests clarification from DE re: making it to the next scheduled meeting for PSI.  DE responds/says he has social worker that can give him rides.  Says he can use his social workers address if the Court needs one.  DE says (608) 524-7966 is the phone number for his social worker if the Court would like to contact her.  Atty Ryan states he can take care of getting contact information to and from DE so he can contact the agent, etc.  DE also provides cell phone number to the Court.  Court will not have DE arrested but admonishes DE re: staying in contact w/agent so the PSI can be completed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Cover Letter from agent
Sentencing hearing on October 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jesse S.J. Griffiths in court with attorney Dennis Joseph Ryan.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  PSI ordered and free to argue.  Attorney Ryan agrees.  Court goes through guilty plea questionnaire with defendant.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI order and to be filed no later than 10-3-2014.  Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
